content: 1997 film ***12 Storeys*** (十二樓 or *Shí'èr lóu* in Mandarin) is a 1997 Singaporean [drama film](/wiki/Drama_(film_and_television)) written and directed by [Eric Khoo](/wiki/Eric_Khoo). It features an [ensemble cast](/wiki/Ensemble_cast) of [Jack Neo](/wiki/Jack_Neo), Koh Boon Pin and [Quan Yi Fong](/wiki/Quan_Yi_Fong). It was screened in the [Un Certain Regard](/wiki/Un_Certain_Regard) section at the [1997 Cannes Film Festival](/wiki/1997_Cannes_Film_Festival). ## Plot The film follows a day in the lives of several households living within the same [HDB](/wiki/Housing_and_Development_Board) block. A soup vendor called Ah Gu is having a hard time dealing with his Mainland Chinese wife, Lily. San San, an overweight loner, is haunted by her feelings of isolation and the memory of her deceased mother. Meng, Trixie and Tee are siblings left to their own devices when their parents go on holiday. ## Cast - [Jack Neo](/wiki/Jack_Neo) as Ah Gu - Koh Boon Pin as Meng - [Quan Yi Fong](/wiki/Quan_Yi_Fong) (credited as Chuang Yi Fong) as Lily - Lum May Yee as Trixie - Lucilla Teoh as San San - Ritz Lim as Spirit - Roderick Lim as Tee - Ronald Toh Chee Kong as Eddy - Loy Lok Yee as Mother - [Tan Kheng Hua](/wiki/Tan_Kheng_Hua) as Spirit's Mother - [Neo Swee Lin](/wiki/Neo_Swee_Lin) as Rachel - [Lim Kay Siu](/wiki/Lim_Kay_Siu) as Hawker - [Lim Kay Tong](/wiki/Lim_Kay_Tong) as Mark ## Reception [Derek Elley](/wiki/Derek_Elley) of *[Variety](/wiki/Variety_(magazine))* wrote that the film's has "genuinely funny" moments, but its slow pacing "blunts the humor". *[Time Out](/wiki/Time_Out_(magazine))* called it "witty and sophisticated stuff". Singapore's [Ministry of Foreign Affairs](/wiki/Ministry_of_Foreign_Affairs_(Singapore)) said that it "is widely regarded to have contributed to the revitalisation of local cinema". - *12 Storeys* at [IMDb](/wiki/IMDb_(identifier)) - Zhao Wei Films This article related to a Singaporean film is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e This article about a 1990s comedy-drama film is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: 12 Storeys
